metadata.title: CVE-2017-9438 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
libyara/re.c in the regexp module in YARA 3.5.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack consumption) via a crafted rule (involving hex strings) that is mishandled in the _yr_re_emit function, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-9304.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9438` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libyara9 - 3.7.1-1ubuntu2
yara - 3.7.1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: yara package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.1-1ubuntu2').
